{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resource Officer",
  "description": "HI DESIGN.CO is&nbsp;a dynamic and innovative interior design company dedicated to creating stunning, functional spaces that inspire and delight our clients. With a focus on creativity, quality, and collaboration, we strive to exceed expectations in every project we undertake. With a team of talented designers and architects, we specialize in residential, commercial, home collection and hospitality projects. Our mission is to exceed client expectations by delivering exceptional design solutions that enhance both functionality and beauty.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ilupeju, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time&nbsp;(Onsite)

Summary


	We are seeking a proactive Human Resource Officer to manage day-to-day HR operations.
	This role requires someone who can take ownership of HR processes, ensure compliance, and contribute to building a productive work culture.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage end-to-end recruitment and onboarding of employees and artisans.
	Coordinate training and development programs to build staff capacity.
	Implement performance management processes, including KPI setting, tracking, and reviews.
	Handle employee relations issues with professionalism and confidentiality.
	Maintain accurate employee records and oversee HR documentation.
	Monitor attendance, leave, and ensure compliance with company policies and labor laws.
	Administer payroll input and employee benefits in line with company standards.
	Prepare HR reports and provide insights for decision-making.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in HR, Business Administration or related field.
	1 - 3 years of HR experience, with exposure to recruitment, payroll, performance management, or employee relations.
	Proficiency in MS Office; familiarity with HRIS tools is a plus.
	Strong interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills.
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise discretion in sensitive HR matters.
	Analytical and problem-solving mindset with attention to detail.
	Interested Applicants must reside within Ilupeju or nearby areas of Lagos for ease of commute.


What We Offer


	Monthly salary: N120,000.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualifid candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hirecruitment2024@gmail.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&ldquo;HR Officer&quot;&nbsp;as the subject of the mail.

Note:&nbsp;Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-18",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

      "addressCountry": "NG"

  },

}



Human Resource Officer Job at HI DESIGN.CO




        
    

        
        HI DESIGN.CO is a dynamic and innovative interior design company dedicated to creating stunning, functional spaces that inspire and delight our clients. With a focus on creativity, quality, and collaboration, we strive to exceed expectations in every project we undertake. With a team of talented designers and architects, we specialize in residential, commercial, home collection and hospitality projects. Our mission is to exceed client expectations by delivering exceptional design solutions that enhance both functionality and beauty.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Officer

Job Location: Ilupeju, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Summary


	We are seeking a proactive Human Resource Officer to manage day-to-day HR operations.
	This role requires someone who can take ownership of HR processes, ensure compliance, and contribute to building a productive work culture.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage end-to-end recruitment and onboarding of employees and artisans.
	Coordinate training and development programs to build staff capacity.
	Implement performance management processes, including KPI setting, tracking, and reviews.
	Handle employee relations issues with professionalism and confidentiality.
	Maintain accurate employee records and oversee HR documentation.
	Monitor attendance, leave, and ensure compliance with company policies and labor laws.
	Administer payroll input and employee benefits in line with company standards.
	Prepare HR reports and provide insights for decision-making.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in HR, Business Administration or related field.
	1 - 3 years of HR experience, with exposure to recruitment, payroll, performance management, or employee relations.
	Proficiency in MS Office; familiarity with HRIS tools is a plus.
	Strong interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills.
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise discretion in sensitive HR matters.
	Analytical and problem-solving mindset with attention to detail.
	Interested Applicants must reside within Ilupeju or nearby areas of Lagos for ease of commute.


What We Offer


	Monthly salary: N120,000.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualifid candidates should send their CV to: hirecruitment2024@gmail.com using “HR Officer" as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Site Engineer",
  "description": "O&#39;la-kleen Nigeria Limited is Nigeria&#39;s foremost cleaning service company with a brand name used as a reference point both locally and internationally. The company has continued to exceed the expectations of clients thereby defining service excellence in the cleaning industry. O&#39;la-kleen Nigeria Limited renders services for the corporate organisation as well as individuals with our clients list ranging from the American Embassy, Central Bank of Nigeria and Nigerian Breweries to mention but a few.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Site Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Description


	The site engineer offers advice in the planning, co-ordination and supervision of technical aspects of construction projects.
	&nbsp;The Site Engineer will establish the level and survey control for contracts and set out detailed works as per the contract drawings, ensuring that checks are made on a regular basis.


Responsibilities


	Managing parts of construction projects.
	Acting as the main technical adviser on a construction site for subcontractors, crafts people and operatives.
	Setting out, levelling and surveying the site.
	Checking plans, drawings and quantities for accuracy of calculations.
	Ensuring that all materials used and work performed are as per specifications.
	Overseeing the selection and requisition of materials and plant.
	Agreeing a price for materials and making cost-effective solutions and proposals for the intended project.
	Managing, monitoring and interpreting the contract design documents supplied by the client or architect.
	Liaising with any consultants, subcontractors, supervisors, planners, quantity surveyors and the general workforce involved in the project.
	Liaising with quantity surveyors about the ordering and negotiating the price of materials.
	Ensuring that health and safety and sustainability policies and legislation are strictly adhered to on site.
	Liaising with the local authority (where appropriate to the project) to ensure compliance with local construction regulations and by-laws
	Communicating with clients and their representatives (architects, engineers and surveyors), including attending regular meetings to keep them informed of progress.
	Day-to-day management of the site, including supervising and monitoring the site labour force and the work of any subcontractors.
	Planning the work and efficiently organising the plant and site facilities in order to meet agreed deadlines.
	Preparing site reports and filling in other paperwork.
	Preparing reports as required;
	Resolving any unexpected technical difficulties and other problems that may arise.
	Any other function as may be assigned by the CEO and/ or GMD.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 / month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to:&nbsp;hr@olakleenholdings.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-03",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-04",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "O'la-kleen Nigeria Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",

    "value": "188323"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {

      "minValue": 150000,
      "maxValue": 250000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Site Engineer Job at O'la-kleen Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        O'la-kleen Nigeria Limited is Nigeria's foremost cleaning service company with a brand name used as a reference point both locally and internationally. The company has continued to exceed the expectations of clients thereby defining service excellence in the cleaning industry. O'la-kleen Nigeria Limited renders services for the corporate organisation as well as individuals with our clients list ranging from the American Embassy, Central Bank of Nigeria and Nigerian Breweries to mention but a few.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Site Engineer

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The site engineer offers advice in the planning, co-ordination and supervision of technical aspects of construction projects.
	 The Site Engineer will establish the level and survey control for contracts and set out detailed works as per the contract drawings, ensuring that checks are made on a regular basis.


Responsibilities


	Managing parts of construction projects.
	Acting as the main technical adviser on a construction site for subcontractors, crafts people and operatives.
	Setting out, levelling and surveying the site.
	Checking plans, drawings and quantities for accuracy of calculations.
	Ensuring that all materials used and work performed are as per specifications.
	Overseeing the selection and requisition of materials and plant.
	Agreeing a price for materials and making cost-effective solutions and proposals for the intended project.
	Managing, monitoring and interpreting the contract design documents supplied by the client or architect.
	Liaising with any consultants, subcontractors, supervisors, planners, quantity surveyors and the general workforce involved in the project.
	Liaising with quantity surveyors about the ordering and negotiating the price of materials.
	Ensuring that health and safety and sustainability policies and legislation are strictly adhered to on site.
	Liaising with the local authority (where appropriate to the project) to ensure compliance with local construction regulations and by-laws
	Communicating with clients and their representatives (architects, engineers and surveyors), including attending regular meetings to keep them informed of progress.
	Day-to-day management of the site, including supervising and monitoring the site labour force and the work of any subcontractors.
	Planning the work and efficiently organising the plant and site facilities in order to meet agreed deadlines.
	Preparing site reports and filling in other paperwork.
	Preparing reports as required;
	Resolving any unexpected technical difficulties and other problems that may arise.
	Any other function as may be assigned by the CEO and/ or GMD.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 / month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: hr@olakleenholdings.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

title: Job Openings at Eastern & Western Hospital
content:
At Eastern & Western Hospital, we offer both orthodox and alternative medicine. We have unique ideas/techniques for health. At E.W.H, with our team of well trained and experience doctors, health cases are treated with ease.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Medical Officer

Job Location: Abuja
Job type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an experienced and skilled Medical Officer to join our team.
	The successful candidate will provide high-quality medical care to our patients, lead and manage a team of medical professionals, and contribute to the development of our medical services.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide expert medical care to patients, including diagnosis, treatment, and management of various medical conditions.
	Lead and manage a team of medical professionals, including junior doctors, nurses, and other healthcare staff.
	Develop and implement clinical guidelines and protocols to ensure best practices in patient care.
	Participate in quality improvement initiatives to enhance patient outcomes and satisfaction.
	Provide training and mentorship to junior medical staff.
	Participate in on-call duties and provide medical coverage as required.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Medicine and Surgery (MBBS) or equivalent.
	At least 5 years of experience as a medical doctor, with a minimum of 1 years in a senior role.
	Valid medical license to practice in Nigeria.
	Excellent clinical and leadership skills.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
	Familiarity with electronic medical records and other healthcare


Salary
N400,000 - N500,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 15th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send in their CV to: ewhhumanresource@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Front Desk Cum Accountant

Job Location: Abuja
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We're seeking a detail-oriented and organized individual to handle front desk responsibilities and accounting tasks.
	The successful candidate will provide excellent customer service, manage financial transactions, and maintain accurate records.


Responsibilities


	Greet clients/customers and respond to inquiries
	Manage front desk operations, including phone calls and emails
	Handle reception duties, maintain office organization
	Provide administrative support as needed
	Manage financial transactions, including invoicing and payments


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree / Higher National Diploma
	Relevant experience
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Basic computer skills (MS Office)
	Attention to detail and organizational skills
	Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits
	Opportunities for professional growth
	Collaborative and supportive team environment.


Application Closing Date: 10th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send in their CV to: ewhhumanresource@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Laboratory Technician

Job Location: Abuja
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We're looking for a detail-oriented Laboratory Technician to support our laboratory team! As a Lab Technician, you'll assist with laboratory testing, equipment maintenance, and data entry.
	If you're organized and enjoy working in a laboratory setting, we'd love to have you on board!


Responsibilities


	Conduct routine laboratory tests
	Prepare samples and reagents
	Maintain laboratory equipment and supplies
	Record and report results
	Assist with quality control and assurance


Requirements


	Associate's Degree or certificate in Laboratory Technology with a Major in Chemistry
	Relevant laboratory experience 
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits
	Opportunities for professional growth
	Collaborative and supportive team environment.


Application Closing Date: 10th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send in their CV to: ewhhumanresource@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Warehouse Manager",
  "description": "At ColaSolar, environmental responsibility is at the core of our operations. We provide clean, renewable solar energy systems that significantly reduce carbon emissions and support global climate change mitigation efforts. By adopting our solar solutions, customers actively participate in creating a more sustainable future while enjoying reliable power.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Warehouse Manager is responsible for overseeing the efficient receipt, storage, inventory control, and&nbsp;dispatch of renewable energy equipment and materials.
	This role ensures that all warehouse activities&nbsp;comply with safety, quality, and operational standards to support smooth field operations and project&nbsp;deployment.
	In the renewable energy sector, accuracy in handling sensitive solar components, batteries, and&nbsp;related gear is critical for timely installations and service delivery.


Main Functions &amp; Responsibilities
Inventory Management:


	Maintain accurate stock levels of solar panels, inverters, batteries, cabling, and tools.
	Use inventory systems to track movements, returns, and reorder points.


Warehouse Operations Oversight:


	Supervise daily operations: receiving, picking, packing, storing, and dispatching.
	Implement efficient layout, storage procedures, and material flow systems.


Safety &amp; Compliance:


	Ensure all warehouse activities meet safety, environmental, and quality regulations.
	Conduct regular safety drills and ensure PPE compliance for staff.


Team Leadership:


	Supervise and train warehouse staff.
	Assign tasks, monitor productivity, and ensure adherence to procedures.


Shipping &amp; Receiving:


	Coordinate inbound and outbound logistics with transport and project teams.
	Verify all deliveries and shipments against documentation.


Asset Tracking &amp; Maintenance:


	Maintain proper records and condition of warehouse equipment (forklifts, tools, etc.).
	Ensure safe storage and handling of delicate and high-value renewable energy components.


Documentation &amp; Reporting:


	Maintain records for stock reconciliation, damage reports, and movement logs.
	Generate daily/weekly inventory and operations reports for management.


Loss Prevention:&nbsp;Identify and mitigate risk of stock loss, theft or damage.

Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree / HND / OND with at least 1 year of experience.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 Monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;hr@colasolar.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Warehouse Manager Job at ColaSolar




        
    

        
        At ColaSolar, environmental responsibility is at the core of our operations. We provide clean, renewable solar energy systems that significantly reduce carbon emissions and support global climate change mitigation efforts. By adopting our solar solutions, customers actively participate in creating a more sustainable future while enjoying reliable power.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Manager

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Warehouse Manager is responsible for overseeing the efficient receipt, storage, inventory control, and dispatch of renewable energy equipment and materials.
	This role ensures that all warehouse activities comply with safety, quality, and operational standards to support smooth field operations and project deployment.
	In the renewable energy sector, accuracy in handling sensitive solar components, batteries, and related gear is critical for timely installations and service delivery.


Main Functions & Responsibilities
Inventory Management:


	Maintain accurate stock levels of solar panels, inverters, batteries, cabling, and tools.
	Use inventory systems to track movements, returns, and reorder points.


Warehouse Operations Oversight:


	Supervise daily operations: receiving, picking, packing, storing, and dispatching.
	Implement efficient layout, storage procedures, and material flow systems.


Safety & Compliance:


	Ensure all warehouse activities meet safety, environmental, and quality regulations.
	Conduct regular safety drills and ensure PPE compliance for staff.


Team Leadership:


	Supervise and train warehouse staff.
	Assign tasks, monitor productivity, and ensure adherence to procedures.


Shipping & Receiving:


	Coordinate inbound and outbound logistics with transport and project teams.
	Verify all deliveries and shipments against documentation.


Asset Tracking & Maintenance:


	Maintain proper records and condition of warehouse equipment (forklifts, tools, etc.).
	Ensure safe storage and handling of delicate and high-value renewable energy components.


Documentation & Reporting:


	Maintain records for stock reconciliation, damage reports, and movement logs.
	Generate daily/weekly inventory and operations reports for management.


Loss Prevention: Identify and mitigate risk of stock loss, theft or damage.

Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree / HND / OND with at least 1 year of experience.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: hr@colasolar.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
